intro: Crepidomanes insigne, commonly known as the noble rock-rose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows on rocky slopes and limestone soils, adapting well to dry and sunny conditions. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are arranged in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. Crepidomanes insigne is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its hardy nature and long blooming period.
